questions.question_text: Raw data acquisition format creates _________ of a data set or suspect drive.

discussion.content: B > Raw Format. This copy technique allowed the creation of simple, sequential, flat files of a data set or suspect drive. Raw format is the output of these flat files.

choices.B: Don't tell the recipients where you are located
choices.C: Don't identify the message as an ad

discussion.content:
A. Don't use deceptive subject lines

The CAN-SPAM Act requires that commercial emails must not use deceptive subject lines and must accurately represent the content of the message. Additionally, it mandates that emails include a valid physical postal address and provide a clear and easy way for recipients to opt out of receiving future emails.

questions.question_text: Which of the following registry hive gives the configuration information about which application was used to open various files on the system?

discussion.content:
A. HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT

The HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT registry hive contains information about file associations, including which applications are associated with which file types. This hive stores the configuration details that help Windows determine which application to use to open a particular file based on its extension.

questions.question_text: Select the tool appropriate for examining the dynamically linked libraries of an application or malware.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
According to CHFI V10 book pg. 1329, DependencyWalker is used to Examine the dynamically linked libraries in the malware executable file

Dependency Walker. CHFI v10 pg. 889 "Investigators should look for DLLs with different names or misspelled DLLs, or functions of the DLLs to identify malicious DLLs. Investigators can use tools such as Dependency Walker for this purpose."
B. SysAnalyzer for dynamic malware analysis

Selected Answer: D
The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act (GLB Act or GLBA), also known as the Financial Modernization Act of 1999, is a federal law enacted in the United States to control the ways financial institutions deal with the private information of individuals

Selected Answer: D
PCI DSS is not a law. Answer D is is a federal law

Selected Answer: D
According to CHFI V10 pg. 77, Enacted in 1999, Gramm–Leach–Bliley Act (GLBA) requires financial institutions-companies that offer consumers financial products or services such as loans, financial or investment advice, or insurance-to explain their information-sharing practices to their customers and to safeguard sensitive data. The objective of the GLBA is to ease the transfer of financial information between institutions and banks while making the rights of the individual through security requirements more specific.

questions.question_text: Which U.S. Federal law requires financial institutions that offer consumers financial products or services to protect their customers' private information?

choices.B: Federal Information Security Management Act of 2002 (FISMA)
choices.A: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS)
choices.C: Health insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA)
